He said he is using droid VPN premium and running some UDP port

[HIDEREACT=1,2,3,4,5,6]
He is using 9201 port but I tried this port it was not working for me. He showed me screenshot it is working for him.
I tried 53 also
[/HIDEREACT]

I think this port is working for many people, I have seen this in our DJ chat group too. Could anyone please help me ?

item.title: Get Free 1GB 4G Data in Himachal pradesh circle

item.dc:creator: UnWanted
item.content:encoded:
Idea Cellular, the third largest operator which offers 4G services in 10 circles has partnered with Ericsson for 4G roll out in the region. However, as the company has less spectrum in 1800 Mhz block, the 4G network would be Narrow Band LTE based which can offer 10-20 Mbps of speed.



According to latest information, the company is offering 1 GB...​

item.title: Idea Now offers more data @398 rs
item.author: invalid@example.com (shameemkdy)
item.dc:creator: shameemkdy
item.content:encoded: Idea Cellular revised its Rs 398 prepaid plan for its subscribers in Andhra Pradesh & Telangana circle. Under the new tariff plan, Idea will be offering benefits for 84 days, instead of the previous 70 days validity period. Apart from the increased validity, the Rs 398 plan gives the same benefits. Also, do make a note that this change is applicable to select Idea prepaid customers in the said circle. And we checked for the same plan in other circles too, but none of them has this plan

item.title: Idea 4G LTE services reach 22 more towns in Karnataka
item.author: invalid@example.com (BlueBird)
item.dc:creator: BlueBird
item.content:encoded:
Idea Cellular’s 4G LTE service has been expanded to 22 more towns in Karnataka circle, taking the total tally to 61, announces a release from the company. With this, the company claimed that it has covered all major towns across all 27 districts.

In 29 out of these over 61 towns, Idea is said to be the sole operator to provide 4G LTE services. Speaking on the expansion, Mr. Siva Ganapathi, Chief...
Click to expand...
Idea 4G LTE services reach 22 more towns in Karnataka
